snippet: The District of Columbia police were hampered because a security guard had locked a video surveillance room, preventing officers from immediately making a clear assessment of the situation, the report says.
abstract: District of Columbia police department report on 2013 Washington Navy Yard shooting finds efforts by law enforcement were delayed because they could not gain access to video surveillance room, preventing them from making clear assessment of the situation; also finds officers had trouble entering the gated facility, finding the correct building and navigating its complex layout as they searched for shooter Aaron Alexis.
lead_paragraph: The District of Columbia police were hampered because a security guard had locked a video surveillance room, preventing officers from immediately making a clear assessment of the situation, the report says.

headline.main: Report Details Hindrances Police Faced in Navy Yard Shooting
headline.print_headline: Report Details Hindrances Police Faced in Navy Yard Shooting
